body_html:
That’s great news! I have in mind pretty much the same functions as @YulaiCong does: the incomplete gamma function, the hypergeometric function 2F1 and the meijer G-function (to implement the derivative of the incomplete gamma).

I have no idea of how complex it would be to integrate these into PyTorch, but would be happy to have a look if you are able to give me some pointers to get started.

Edit: I don’t think the G-function is implemented in Cephes but there is a python (slow) implementation in mpmath. This should probably go in a separate issue.

body:
That’s great news! I have in mind pretty much the same functions as @YulaiCong does: the incomplete gamma function, the hypergeometric function 2F1 and the meijer G-function (to implement the derivative of the incomplete gamma).

I have no idea of how complex it would be to integrate these into PyTorch, but would be happy to have a look if you are able to give me some pointers to get started.

Edit: I don’t think the G-function is implemented in Cephes but there is a python (slow) implementation in mpmath. This should probably go in a separate issue.
